abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Airports Development
            Project for Egypt were as follows: outcomes were highly
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            sector reform can only be progressive and the Bank's
            support through a large scale investment lending operation
            can make a difference, if provided through an early dialogue
            during implementation, and focused on strategic aspects,
            high policy advice, and game changing issues. Management
            contracts are an effective Public Private Partnerships (PPP)
            model to foster the modernization of economically viable
            public entities, enhance operational and financial
            performance, and transfer know-how, especially when private
            partners are competitively selected at an early stage, on
            the basis of well prepared bidding documents. Large
            infrastructure investments like airports can successfully
            contribute to a country's economic development, through
            regional integration, facilitation of trade, increased
            currency earning tourism, and direct job creation from
            attracted economic activities when a critical mass is
            achieved. The Bank's attention and responsiveness
            during preparation and a strong support all along the
            project implementation is instrumental for the success of a
            project. The demonstration of solid knowledge and timely
            delivery of projects enhances the Bank-country relationship.
            The quality, completeness, and relevance of the design, as
            well as a strong engineer during construction, can
            significantly contribute to controlling final costs.

5087407.majtheme: Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the
            Airports Development Project, closely interrelated, are to
            eliminate capacity bottlenecks to traffic growth,
            particularly for tourism and associated foreign exchange
            earnings; raise the service quality of the Cairo
            International Airport and Sham El Sheikh Airport to
            international best practice standards; and promote efficient
            private participation in airport management and airport
            service delivery in a more competitive market. There are
            three project components:  Component 1 constructs a third
            terminal at Cairo International Airport and enabling works.
            Component 2: constructs a new terminal at Sharm El Sheikh
            Airport and enabling works. Component 3 strengthens sector
            operations and environmental management.

repnme.cdata!:
Egypt - Airport Development Project :
            environmental and social assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental and social
            impact assessment of the Airport Development Project for
            Egypt, which increases the landside and airside capacities
            at Cairo International Airport and the landside capacity at
            Sharm El Shaikh Airport. It details expected adverse
            environmental impacts and mitigation measures, the majority
            of which will be incorporated in the project design. Further
            mitigation measures to dispose of construction waste; and
            minimize hazards to workforce and resident populations
            during construction include the following: Use good site
            practices, construct temporary noise barriers, relocate
            equipment, reduce number of plant items and limit equipment
            operating time, and require workers to wear protective gear
            to reduce noise impacts. Dust suppression measures include
            regular watering of exposed areas, site access and egress
            control, development of a haulage route, restriction of
            vehicle speed and exhaust, locating stockpiles far away from
            sensitive areas and using impervious sheeting as covers, or
            spraying with water or a suppression chemical. Maintain
            evaporation ponds in site drainage to manage surface run
            off, lock storage tanks to prevent spilled fuel oils, empty
            and clean oil interceptors to prevent release into the storm
            water drainage system, dispose of waste materials at an
            approved storage site, use portable chemical toilets and
            sewage holding tanks, and only handle and store contaminants
            in designated areas and ensure that a spill management plan
            is in place. To control excavated waste, construction waste,
            and general refuse, use a waste management plan that
            minimizes waste generated, reuses on-site materials,
            segregates and recycles waste, and treats and disposes of
            waste according to relevant regulations outlining procedures
            for handling, collecting, removing, and disposing of waste.
            Ensure that chemical waste is properly stored and contained,
            using impervious, corrosive-free vessels (in capsulated
            barrels  with cement), in well ventilated areas and removed
            by licensed waste collectors and transported to licensed
            waste facilities. Ensure public safety by gating access to
            the construction site, reducing interaction between
            construction and airport traffic during morning and
            afternoon peak periods, and fencing to prevent accidental or
            unauthorized entry. Parking and pedestrian movements will be
            monitored to assess the need for added measures. Reduce
            traffic congestion by using signage, enforcing illegal
            parking rules, and completing a feasibility study to
            evaluate different options, if needed.

            mitigation measures to dispose of construction waste; and
            minimize hazards to workforce and resident populations
            during construction include the following: Use good site
            practices, construct temporary noise barriers, relocate
            equipment, reduce number of plant items and limit equipment
            operating time, and require workers to wear protective gear
            to reduce noise impacts. Dust suppression measures include
            regular watering of exposed areas, site access and egress
            control, development of a haulage route, restriction of
            vehicle speed and exhaust, locating stockpiles far away from
            sensitive areas and using impervious sheeting as covers, or
            spraying with water or a suppression chemical. Maintain
            evaporation ponds in site drainage to manage surface run
            off, lock storage tanks to prevent spilled fuel oils, empty
            and clean oil interceptors to prevent release into the storm
            water drainage system, dispose of waste materials at an
            approved storage site, use portable chemical toilets and
            sewage holding tanks, and only handle and store contaminants
            in designated areas and ensure that a spill management plan
            is in place. To control excavated waste, construction waste,
            and general refuse, use a waste management plan that
            minimizes waste generated, reuses on-site materials,
            segregates and recycles waste, and treats and disposes of
            waste according to relevant regulations outlining procedures
            for handling, collecting, removing, and disposing of waste.
            Ensure that chemical waste is properly stored and contained,
            using impervious, corrosive-free vessels (in capsulated
            barrels  with cement), in well ventilated areas and removed
            by licensed waste collectors and transported to licensed
            waste facilities. Ensure public safety by gating access to
            the construction site, reducing interaction between
            construction and airport traffic during morning and
            afternoon peak periods, and fencing to prevent accidental or
            unauthorized entry. Parking and pedestrian movements will be
            monitored to assess the need for added measures. Reduce
            traffic congestion by using signage, enforcing illegal
            parking rules, and completing a feasibility study to
            evaluate different options, if needed.

            Sharm El Shaikh extension - Annexes
